verbs.description: hostilize (third-person singular simple present hostilizes, present participle hostilizing, simple past and past participle hostilized)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To make hostile; to cause to become an enemy.
examples: When England, Spain, Holland, and Russia united with the powers already hostilized against an impious nation, that had reduced robbery, murder, and profaneness to a cool and practical system, I thought there was the fairest prospect of their success .
